snippet: Bill de Blasio repeatedly linked Joseph J. Lhota to what he called an obstructionist national Republican Party, while Mr. Lhota raised questions about Mr. de Blasio’s managerial experience.
abstract: New York City Democratic mayoral candidate Bill de Blasio relentlessly pounds his Republican rival Joseph J Lhota in their first televised debate; de Blasio dominates hourlong confrontation, repeatedly linking Lhota to what he called an obstructionist national Republican Party, while Lhota attempts to raise questions about de Blasio’s managerial experience.

byline.original: By MICHAEL BARBARO and MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM

lead_paragraph: Bill de Blasio repeatedly linked Joseph J. Lhota to what he called an obstructionist national Republican Party, while Mr. Lhota raised questions about Mr. de Blasio’s managerial experience.

headline.main: De Blasio, Attacking Lhota, Dominates in Their First Debate
headline.print_headline: De Blasio, Attacking Lhota, Dominates Debate
